pull.title: ci: Use macos-14 GHA image (x86_64-apple-darwin22.6.0 -> arm64-apple-darwin23.6.0)
pull.body:
There shouldn't be any downside, because XCode remains pinned to the same version.

However, builds are expected to be a bit faster with M1, which seems nice.

### Master 

* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/10895856163/job/30234757205#step:3:12

```
Apple clang version 15.0.0 (clang-1500.0.40.1)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin22.6.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode_15.0.1.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
```

* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/10895856163/job/30234757205#step:7:2006: (43 minutes with 21% ccache hit rate)

### Pull

* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/10898683046/job/30242410317?pr=30913#step:3:12

```
Apple clang version 15.0.0 (clang-1500.0.40.1)
Target: arm64-apple-darwin23.6.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode_15.0.1.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
```

* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/10898683046/job/30242410317?pr=30913#step:7:1953: (26 minutes with 0% ccache hit rate)

Concept ACK.

Very much in favour of speeding these jobs up! Changes look good to me so far, just one Q on the jobname with this change in architecture.

ci: Remove incorrectly hardcoded HOST in mac_native task

The HOST is wrong, because this is a native build, where the HOST is
supposed to be auto-detected.

events.message:
ci: Remove incorrectly hardcoded HOST in mac_native task

The HOST is wrong, because this is a native build, where the HOST is
supposed to be auto-detected.

events.body:
Concept ACK.

Perhaps explicitly mention the switch from the `x86_64` architecture to `arm64`?

rename.to: ci: Use macos-14 GHA image (x86_64-apple-darwin22.6.0 -> arm64-apple-darwin23.6.0)

events.body:
> Perhaps explicitly mention the switch from the `x86_64` architecture to `arm64`?

Sure, done

ACK fab932b4211ea0a4c10e484c08042552f9c58c15.

We were already using an `arm64` CI task before https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28187.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -74,11 +74,11 @@ jobs:
           # Use clang++, because it is a bit faster and uses less memory than g++
           git rebase --exec "echo Running test-one-commit on \$( git log -1 ) && CC=clang CXX=clang++ cmake -B build -DWITH_ZMQ=ON -DBUILD_GUI=ON -DBUILD_BENCH=ON -DBUILD_FUZZ_BINARY=ON -DWITH_BDB=ON -DWITH_NATPMP=ON -DWITH_MINIUPNPC=ON -DWITH_USDT=ON && cmake --build build -j $(nproc) && ctest --test-dir build -j $(nproc) && ./build/test/functional/test_runner.py -j $(( $(nproc) * 2 ))" ${{ env.TEST_BASE }}
 
-  macos-native-x86_64:
-    name: 'macOS 13 native, x86_64, no depends, sqlite only, gui'
+  macos-native-arm64:
comments.body: This is still building using x86_64-apple-darwin as the host (from 00_setup_env_mac_native.sh). I wonder if the "native" here is therefore confusing?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -74,11 +74,11 @@ jobs:
           # Use clang++, because it is a bit faster and uses less memory than g++
           git rebase --exec "echo Running test-one-commit on \$( git log -1 ) && CC=clang CXX=clang++ cmake -B build -DWITH_ZMQ=ON -DBUILD_GUI=ON -DBUILD_BENCH=ON -DBUILD_FUZZ_BINARY=ON -DWITH_BDB=ON -DWITH_NATPMP=ON -DWITH_MINIUPNPC=ON -DWITH_USDT=ON && cmake --build build -j $(nproc) && ctest --test-dir build -j $(nproc) && ./build/test/functional/test_runner.py -j $(( $(nproc) * 2 ))" ${{ env.TEST_BASE }}
 
-  macos-native-x86_64:
-    name: 'macOS 13 native, x86_64, no depends, sqlite only, gui'
+  macos-native-arm64:
comments.body:
That sounds like a bug in the CI config. However, it should be harmless, because `HOST` is unused (apart from a folder naming), because depends isn't used here.

I'll add an unrelated bugfix commit to remove the wrong config value.
